trans-unit.source: Displays a check box that allows the user to select a `true` or `false` condition.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#Introduction)
[Declarative Syntax](#DeclarativeSyntax)
Introduction
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control to allow the user to select a `true` or `false` state.

If you plan to use multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> controls, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control is an alternative control that provides convenient data binding capabilities.
However, individual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> controls provide greater control over layout.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control accepts user input, which is a potential security threat.
By default, ASP.NET mobile Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements.
For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07).
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> class.
Adds the HTML attributes and styles of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control to be rendered to the specified output stream.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method is used primarily by control developers to insert the additional attributes and styles in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> output stream for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> state automatically posts back to the server when clicked.
Use this property to specify whether the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is posted back to the server when clicked.
Setting this property to `true` causes a round trip to the server every time the control is clicked.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
`true` to automatically post the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control to the server when it is clicked; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control is selected.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CausesValidation%2A> property to determine whether validation is performed on both the client and the server when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is selected.
Page validation determines whether the input controls that are associated with a validation control on the page all pass the validation rules as specified by the validation control.
By default, clicking a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control does not cause page validation.
To perform page validation when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is clicked, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CausesValidation%2A> property to `true`.

When the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CausesValidation%2A> property is set to `true`, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.ValidationGroup%2A> property to specify the name of the validation group for which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control causes validation.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
`true` if validation is performed when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> is clicked; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control is checked.
Use this property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is checked.
This property can also be used to programmatically set the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
`true` to indicate a checked state; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Checked"></xref> property changes between posts to the server.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CheckedChanged> event is raised when the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Checked%2A> property changes between posts to the server.
This event does not post the page back to the server unless the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.AutoPostBack%2A> property is set to `true`.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control must persist some values between posts to the server for this event to work correctly.
Be sure that view state is enabled for this control.
For more information about handling events, see [How to: Consume Events in a Web Forms Application](~/docs/standard/events/how-to-consume-events-in-a-web-forms-application.md).
Gets a reference to the collection of attributes for the rendered input element of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is rendered and displayed using an HTML INPUT element.

You can add additional attributes to the rendered INPUT element using the <xref:System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection.Add%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.InputAttributes%2A> property.
The collection of attribute names and values that are added to the rendered INPUT element for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection"></xref>.
Gets a reference to the collection of attributes for the rendered LABEL element of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is rendered and displayed using an HTML LABEL element.

You can add additional attributes to the rendered LABEL element using the <xref:System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection.Add%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.LabelAttributes%2A> property.
The collection of attribute names and values that are added to the rendered LABEL element for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref>.
The default is an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection"></xref>.
Processes the postback data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.LoadPostData%2A> method is used primarily by control developers.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.LoadPostData%2A> method checks if the postback data of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is different from its previous value, and if so, loads the content and returns `true`.
The index within the posted collection that references the content to load.
The collection posted to the server.
`true` if the posted content is different from the last posting; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.LoadViewState%2A> method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> object from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.SaveViewState%2A> method.
An object that contains the saved view state values for the control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CheckedChanged"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
This allows you to handle the event directly.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CheckedChanged> event is raised when the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Checked%2A> property changes between posts to the server.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control must persist some values between posts to the server for this event to work correctly.
Be sure that view state is enabled for this control.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [How to: Consume Events in a Web Forms Application](~/docs/standard/events/how-to-consume-events-in-a-web-forms-application.md)
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.OnCheckedChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Registers client script for generating postback prior to rendering on the client if <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.AutoPostBack"></xref> is `true`.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

Invokes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.OnCheckedChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method when the posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control has changed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method is used primarily by control developers.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.OnCheckedChanged%2A> method if the posted data for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control has changed.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CausesValidation%2A> property is `true`, the controls that are set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.ValidationGroup%2A> property are validated.
Displays the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> on the client.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains the output stream to render on the client.
Saves the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.SaveViewState%2A> method is used primarily by control developers.
View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties.
These values are automatically placed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property for the server control, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save-state stage of the server control's life cycle.
For more information, see [ASP.NET Page Life Cycle Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7949d756-1a79-464e-891f-904b1cfc7991).
When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in a hidden HTML input element.

When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.SaveViewState%2A> and modifying the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property for your server control.

For more information, see [Developing Custom ASP.NET Server Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fbe26c16-cff4-4089-b3dd-877411f0c0ef) and [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
The object that contains the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> view state; otherwise, if no view state is associated with the object, `null`.
Gets or sets the text label associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref>.
Use this property to specify the text label associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control.
This property can also be used to programmatically get the text label associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control.
This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.
Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input.
For more information, see [How to: Consume Events in a Web Forms Application](~/docs/standard/events/how-to-consume-events-in-a-web-forms-application.md).
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text label associated with the `CheckBox`.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the alignment of the text label associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
Use this property to specify the alignment of the text label associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control.
You can specify whether the text label appears to the right or left of the check box.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Text%2A> property to specify the label text.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign"></xref> values.
The default value is `Right`.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign"></xref> values.
Tracks view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control so that they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This object is accessible through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> property.
ASP.NET automatically calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.TrackViewState%2A> method when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control is initialized.
Gets or sets the group of controls for which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
Validation groups allow you to assign validation controls on a page to a specific category.
Each validation group can be validated independently of other validation groups on the page.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.ValidationGroup%2A> property to specify the name of the validation group for which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control causes validation when it posts back to the server.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.ValidationGroup%2A> property has an effect only when the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CausesValidation%2A> property is set to `true`.

When you specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.ValidationGroup%2A> property, only the validation controls that are part of the specified group are validated when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control posts back to the server.

If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.ValidationGroup%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CausesValidation%2A> property is set to `true`, all validation controls on the page that are not assigned to a validation group are validated when the control posts back to the server.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
The group of controls for which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> causes validation when it posts back to the server.
The default is an empty string ("").
Processes posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> control.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> determines the posted <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Checked%2A> state.
The key value used to index an entry in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> that contains post information.
`true` if the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox"></xref> has changed; otherwise `false`.
Raises when posted data for a control has changed.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> fires an `CheckedChanged` event.
